climbs.name: Unknown left of Midnight at the Oasis

content.description: Looks like garbage, climbs like a dream. Fun laybacks and (amazingly) good rock, culminating in an initially perplexing overhang towards the end. I encourage you to wander a bit to figure this out.

Ease into the route clipping the first two bolts while avoiding the grungy horizontal band.  Pull a move to obtain a rest on less-than-vertical terrain before sprinting to the chains.  The final dash beginnings with the thin edging crux but the stopwatch continues to tick while the hands paw past slopers and probe for in-cut edges. 

  While the crux sequence is technically harder than that of Oasis there is a near no-hands rest in the middle, immediately prior to the business, which greatly reduces the pump.  The rock on this route is of a lesser quality than the upper tier, or right routes, on this wall.
content.location: Third route from the left; rightmost route on the lower tier.  The dark, blank-looking route Midnight at the Oasis is to the left; the wide crack is to the right.
Second from right on upper platform.

content.description: Balancy moves on starting crack and sustained face climbing above.
content.location: Third route from right on upper platform. Up through crack with chockstone

content.description: A fun balancy and technical route on decent rock.  This climbs a lot like the top of Tsunami at Windy Point.  The holds are generally plentiful, but choosing how to use them, and keeping the pump at bay is the challenge.  The rock is a bit funky, especially at the start, but seems to be decently solid.  If the rock were better it would get another star.  The movement is quite good.
content.location: Second bolted route from the left.  Starts up a broken corner system, with two small saguaros growing just the right.  Trends right after the 4th bolt.

content.description: Good edges and sustained fun moves. Kind of easy to end up going the wrong way at several spots.

we belayed from a boulder on the right side of the pond about 20 ft up. (gear)   lower the leader to the bottom of the waterfall and transition to the face.    pull some great moves on horizontal cracks and go up and left to a small crack.
content.protection:
few small and medium and a couple bigger cams if you have them  

  belay w gear (small medium)   walk off

content.description: Thinner start gets juggier as you get higher.

Up the wash and turn left, first wall on the left with about 8 routes. First three have  a crumbly and steep belay area. There's a crack route in between and the last four have a good platform to belay from.
